q: Elasticity is one of the AWS Cloud architecture principles. Which of the following is an example of Elasticity?
a: Scale compute resources in and out while only paying for the resources used
d: Scaling AWS resources using Elastic Load Balancer (ELB)
Connecting on-premise Data centers with AWS VPC using Direct Connect
e: Elasticity is the ability to automatically acquire resources as you need them and release them when you don't, matching supply with demand.

q: You suspect that your AWS account is compromised. Who should you report this to?
e: If you suspect YOUR account is compromised (e.g., unauthorized root login), contact AWS Support (Trust & Safety) immediately. Note: The Abuse Team is for reporting attacks COMING from AWS resources.

q: Which feature allows you to categorize and track your AWS costs by project or department in your billing reports?
e: Cost Allocation Tags are metadata (key-value pairs) you attach to resources. You can activate them in the billing console to track costs by those tags.

q: Which credential is required to establish a secure SSH connection to a Linux-based EC2 instance?
e: A Key Pair (public/private key) is required to authenticate via SSH to an EC2 instance. Passwords are disabled by default.

q: What are the three main models for cloud computing? (Select THREE)
a: Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), Software as a Service (SaaS)
e: The three standard cloud service models are IaaS (Infrastructure), PaaS (Platform), and SaaS (Software).

q: Which of the below options are you responsible for when running an RDS database on AWS?
d: Controlling access to the host machine
e: RDS is a managed service. AWS handles the OS, patching, and hardware. You are responsible for the data and managing database access.

q: What are design principles for performance efficiency in the cloud? (Select TWO)
a: Experiment more often, Use serverless architectures
e: Performance Efficiency principles include democratizing advanced technologies, going global, using serverless architectures, and experimenting more often.

q: Which of the following is the document used to grant permissions to users, groups, and roles?
e: Permissions in IAM are defined in JSON documents called Policies.

q: Which of the following scenarios are examples of scaling an IT architecture vertically? (Select TWO)
a: Resizing an EC2 instance type from T2.micro to T2.large, Change the RDS instance type to one with more CPU/RAM
e: Vertical scaling (Scaling Up) means increasing the specifications (CPU/RAM) of a single resource. Horizontal scaling (Scaling Out) means adding more resources.

q: A company wants to decouple their monolithic application. Which AWS service can help them to achieve this?
e: SQS (Simple Queue Service) acts as a buffer between components, allowing them to operate independently (decoupled).

q: If you want access to all AWS Trusted Advisor checks, which of these support plans will provide that? (Select TWO)
e: The full set of Trusted Advisor checks is only available to the Business and Enterprise support plans.

q: Which service can be used to create and provide trusted users with temporary security credentials?
e: AWS STS enables you to request temporary, limited-privilege credentials for users.

q: A company needs to view their AWS expenses and service usage over time in graphical form. Which AWS service will provide this information?
e: Cost Explorer is the tool for visualizing and analyzing your costs and usage history.

q: Which of the following is a hybrid cloud storage with local caching service that allows on-premises applications to access data on AWS Cloud?
e: AWS Storage Gateway connects on-premises appliances with cloud-based storage, often using local caching for speed.

q: A user has to migrate petabytes of data to AWS. Which service is MORE cost-effective and FASTER than transferring data over 100 Mbps internet connection?
e: For petabyte-scale transfers with limited bandwidth, Snowball (physical transport) is significantly faster and cheaper than the internet.

q: How would you describe the value proposition of AWS Cloud? (Select TWO)
a: Stop guessing about Capacity, Trade capital expense for variable expense
d: Managing lift and shift of your data center to AWS
e: Key benefits: Trade CapEx for OpEx (Variable expense) and Stop guessing capacity (Elasticity).

q: What tasks can only be done using root user credentials? (Select TWO)
a: Close the AWS account, Change the AWS Support plan
e: Only the root user can close the account and change the support plan (and a few other account-level tasks).

q: A company has developed a media transcoding application designed to recover gracefully from failures. Which instance type is most cost-effective?
e: Since the application handles failure gracefully, Spot Instances (up to 90% discount) are the best choice.

q: You are using your corporate directory to grant your users access to AWS services. What is this called?
e: Federation involves using an external identity provider (IdP) to manage users and granting them access to AWS resources.

q: You see resources in your AWS account that you don't remember creating. What are the most immediate actions you should take? (Select TWO)
a: Change your AWS account root user password, Delete any unrecognized or unauthorized resources
d: Ask for help on AWS forums
e: If compromised: Secure the account (change credentials) and remove the threat (delete resources) immediately.

q: A company is launching a new web application attracting high traffic. As part of Enterprise support, what provides architectural/scaling guidance?
e: Infrastructure Event Management (IEM) is available to Enterprise customers to help plan for large-scale launches.

q: Which of the following Amazon EC2 pricing models automatically applies to usage across different instance families and regions?
e: Compute Savings Plans offer the most flexibility, applying to usage across any instance family and region.

q: A company has launched an image-sharing app and expects spiky and unpredictable traffic. Which is the MOST cost-effective instance pricing model?
e: For unpredictable/spiky traffic where you cannot commit to a term, On-Demand is the standard choice. (Spot is risky if interruptions cannot be handled).

q: AWS recommends decoupling applications. What is the advantage of this approach?
a: Reduce inter-dependencies so failures do not impact other components
d: Ability to deploy the application through a single deployment
e: Decoupling prevents cascading failures. If one component fails, the others can continue to work.

q: Under the Shared Responsibility Model, which of the below are you responsible for when storing data in S3? (Select TWO)
d: Who has access to the network hardware
Who has access to S3 hardware
Who has access to the S3 Infrastructure
e: You control the data (encryption) and the configuration (policies/ACLs). AWS manages the physical infrastructure.

q: A company has developed an application and want to cache its data closer to users? Which of the following AWS services can they use?
e: CloudFront is a Global Content Delivery Network (CDN) that caches content at Edge Locations.

q: What feature of the AWS Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) can you use to capture IP traffic going to and from network interfaces in your VPC?
e: VPC Flow Logs capture information about IP traffic going to and from network interfaces.

q: Which of the following are examples of AWS-Managed Services? (Select THREE)
a: Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon Redshift, AWS Lambda
e: Managed services abstract the OS and server management. EC2 is unmanaged (you manage the OS).

q: Which service is the most cost-effective for protection against network and transport layer DDoS attacks?
e: AWS Shield Standard is free and provides automatic protection against common Layer 3/4 attacks.

q: Your manager asks you to estimate monthly cost of AWS services the new application based on expected usage. What tool can you use to calculate?
d: AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) calculator
e: The AWS Pricing Calculator is the modern web-based planning tool for estimating costs. (Simple Monthly Calculator is deprecated).

q: What is the AWS automated security assessment service that helps improve the security and compliance of applications deployed on AWS?
e: Inspector automatically assesses applications for exposure, vulnerabilities, and deviations from best practices.

q: It is crucial to store database backup on a medium which is secure and makes database readily available. What is the most cost-effective storage option?
e: S3 Standard or S3 Standard-IA are 'readily available' and cheaper than EBS/EFS. Glacier is cheaper but not 'readily available'.

q: A company is migrating their applications/databases to AWS to reduce cost. Which factor is main for choosing instance type of RDS/Redshift?
e: Instance types are primarily defined by their CPU and Memory (RAM) capacity.

q: What is the recommended way to give your applications running in EC2 permission to make API requests to other AWS resources?
a: Create an IAM Role and assign it to the instance
d: Create an IAM User and embed keys
Save Access Key ID in config file
e: Always use IAM Roles for compute services to avoid managing long-term credentials.

q: In AWS' Global Infrastructure, what are Edge Locations responsible for?
e: Edge Locations are used by CloudFront to cache content closer to end-users.

q: What is the minimum level of AWS support that provides 24x7 access to Cloud support engineers via phone, email and chat?
e: Developer has business hours access. Business Support is the first tier with 24/7 phone/chat/email.

q: Which of the following are true about Amazon Route 53? (Select TWO)
a: It allows you to check the health of your resources, It provides a highly available and scalable DNS web service
d: It is named after Route 53 in the USA
e: Route 53 is a global DNS service that also performs health checks on resources.

q: Which of the following AWS services control Authentication and Authorization within an AWS account?
e: IAM (Identity and Access Management) handles AuthN (who you are) and AuthZ (what you can do).

q: Which of the following is an AWS database service that provides virtually unlimited throughput and storage?
e: DynamoDB is a serverless key-value DB that scales horizontally to support virtually any throughput.

q: Which of the following are AWS Infrastructure automation tools? (Select TWO)
e: CloudFormation (IaC) and OpsWorks (Configuration Management) are used to automate infrastructure provisioning.

q: Which of the following enables you to set up a logically isolated section of your cloud?
e: A Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) is your isolated network environment in the cloud.

q: What are the change management tools that help AWS customers audit and monitor all resource changes in their AWS environment? (Select TWO)
e: CloudTrail records the API calls (Who/When), and AWS Config records the state changes (What changed).

q: What are access types for IAM user? (Select TWO)
a: Programmatic access, AWS Management Console access
e: IAM Users can be given Console access (password) and/or Programmatic access (Access Keys).

q: What are the default security credentials that are required to access the AWS management console for an IAM user account?
e: Console access requires a username and password. Access Keys are for CLI/SDK.

q: A company is looking for help in designing a new cloud application that adheres to AWS's best practices. Which of the following can provide guidance?
e: The Well-Architected Tool compares your workload against the 6 pillars of the Well-Architected Framework.

q: In AWS Well-Architected Framework, which of the following are components of the Security Pillar? (Select THREE)
e: Security pillar focuses on protecting information. Key topics: IAM, Detective Controls, Infra Protection, Data Protection, Incident Response.

q: Which of the following is a practice to minimize dependencies between components and to avoid one point of failure?
e: Loose coupling (using queues, etc.) ensures components are not strictly dependent on one another's availability.

q: You are developing a distributed application which requires task coordination across all components. Which of the following AWS services will help with that?
e: AWS Step Functions is the modern serverless orchestration service for coordinating distributed applications.

q: Which of the following activities may help reduce your AWS monthly costs?
a: Enabling Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling for all of your workloads
d: Using On-Demand Instances for all workloads
e: Auto Scaling allows you to turn off resources when they aren't needed, preventing you from paying for idle capacity.

q: Which feature of the cloud eliminates the need to estimate future application usage?
e: Elasticity (scaling) removes the need to guess capacity; you scale as demand dictates.

q: What is the easiest way to launch and manage a virtual private server in AWS?
e: Lightsail provides a simplified, pre-configured VPS experience for simple workloads.

q: Which of the following is AWS' managed DDoS protection service? (Select TWO)
a: AWS Shield Advanced, AWS Shield Standard
e: AWS Shield is the dedicated DDoS protection service.

q: Deploying your EC2 instances across multiple AZs will help address which Cloud Concept?
e: Using multiple Availability Zones ensures your application stays available even if one data center fails.

q: Which AWS service is a fully managed Pub/Sub messaging service used for fan-out messaging?
e: Amazon SNS (Simple Notification Service) enables Pub/Sub messaging for fan-out architectures (one message to multiple subscribers).

q: At which two levels can you configure access control for S3? (Select TWO)
e: S3 access is controlled via Bucket Policies (Resource-based) and ACLs (Legacy Object-based).

q: Which of the following factors should be considered when determining the region in which AWS Resources will be provisioned? (Select TWO)
e: Choose regions based on where your data legally must reside (Sovereignty) and proximity to users (Latency).

q: For AWS Enterprise support users, how does AWS help with infrastructure event management?
a: AWS helps users plan for large-scale events such as product launches and marketing events
d: AWS manages the event for you
e: IEM is a structured program to help plan and execute major events to ensure stability.

q: Which of the following AWS Identity and Access Management best practices adds an extra layer of protection in addition to the default authentication mechanism of usernames and passwords?
e: MFA requires a second factor (token/device) to login, significantly increasing security.

q: A company is managing a message-broker themselves and want to move it to fully managed cloud service without rewriting the messaging code in their applications. Which AWS service can they use?
e: Amazon MQ supports standard protocols (MQTT, AMQP) for ActiveMQ/RabbitMQ, allowing migration without rewriting code.

q: Your company has been experiencing issues with their MySQL database. They have decided to migrate their database to AWS so they do not have to spend time on managing backups, patching, disaster recovery and performance. Which of the following AWS service will help them implement this?
e: RDS automates backups, patching, and high availability for relational databases like MySQL.

q: What are AWS' recommendations regarding root access keys?
a: Delete them (if they exist) and do not create new ones
e: The root account should NOT have access keys. If it does, delete them. Use IAM users for programmatic access.

q: One of the design principles in the Reliability pillar of AWS Well-Architected Framework is 'Scale horizontally to increase aggregate system availability'. How can we achieve this? (Select TWO)
a: Distribute requests across multiple smaller resources, Replace one large resource with multiple small resources
d: Increase the size of the instance
e: Horizontal scaling = adding more instances. Vertical scaling = increasing instance size.

q: What service does AWS offer to simplify the connection management among hundreds of VPCs in multiple AWS regions?
e: Transit Gateway acts as a cloud router to connect VPCs and on-prem networks centrally.

q: Which of the following cache engines are supported by Amazon ElastiCache? (Select TWO)
e: ElastiCache is for in-memory stores: Redis and Memcached.

q: You have launched your application to international users, but international users are complaining of high latency. What is the AWS characteristic that can help improve your international users experience?
e: AWS Global Reach (Global Infrastructure) lets you deploy in regions closer to your users.

q: Which of the following are principles of sound cloud design? (Select TWO)
e: Design for failure (disposable resources) and loose coupling/scalability are key cloud principles.

q: What is the AWS service that enables AWS architects to manage infrastructure as code?
e: CloudFormation provisions resources based on JSON/YAML templates (Infrastructure as Code).

q: A company wants to consolidate billing from all of their AWS accounts to benefit from single payment method for all of their AWS accounts. Which service will you recommend them to use?
e: AWS Organizations enables Consolidated Billing for multiple accounts.

q: You and your team are responsible for analysing logs to detect any malicious activity or threat. Your manager is concerned that it is time-consuming and unreliable to analyses logs manually so wants to use AWS managed service for this. Which service will you recommend for this purpose?
e: GuardDuty uses ML to analyze CloudTrail, VPC Flow, and DNS logs for threats automatically.

q: A company wants to enable cross-region replication on the S3 bucket. Which S3 feature should be enabled before cross-region replication can be used?
e: Versioning must be enabled on both source and destination buckets for Replication to work.

q: What is the AWS service that performs automated network assessments of Amazon EC2 instances to check for vulnerabilities?
e: Inspector checks for network reachability and software vulnerabilities.

q: Which of the following are components of the site-to-site VPN connection? (Select TWO)
e: A Site-to-Site VPN consists of a VGW (AWS side) and a Customer Gateway (On-prem side).

q: Which AWS service enables developers and data scientists to quickly and easily build, train, and deploy machine learning models at any scale?
e: SageMaker is the end-to-end ML service.

q: Which of the following strategies help analyze cost in AWS?
e: Tagging resources (e.g., CostCenter=101) allows you to allocate costs in billing reports.

q: Which of the following is a fully managed extract, transform, and load (ETL) service that makes it easy for customers to prepare and load their data for analytics?
e: AWS Glue is the serverless ETL service.

q: Which service provides DNS in the AWS cloud?
e: Route 53 is the Managed DNS service.

q: You are System Administrator and your company's CEO has recently come to know about the benefits of the AWS Cloud. The CEO wants to find out the savings your company will make if they migrate to the AWS Cloud. Which AWS tool will you use to estimate savings?
e: TCO (Total Cost of Ownership) tools help compare the costs of running on-premises vs. AWS.

q: Which AWS database service is best suited for non-relational databases?
e: DynamoDB is the flagship NoSQL (non-relational) database.

q: As part of security review, your company has decided to make users choose strong passwords. What is the most reliable way to ensure that users are using strong passwords?
e: IAM Password Policies enforce length, complexity, and rotation requirements.

q: Which of the following procedures would you suggest reducing the Amazon S3 costs?
a: Use Lifecycle Policies to move data to correct storage classes
e: Lifecycle policies automate moving data to cheaper tiers (like Glacier) as it ages.

q: How can ELBs improve the fault tolerance of your application?
a: By stopping traffic to unhealthy instances
d: By increasing the speed of the instance
By reducing the cost of the instance
e: ELBs perform health checks and only route traffic to healthy instances, masking failures from users.

q: As part of the AWS Migration Acceleration Program (MAP), what does AWS provide to accelerate Enterprise adoption of AWS? (Select TWO)
e: MAP provides methodology, tools, and expertise (ProServe/Training) to help migrate.

q: Which of the following are part of AWS shared controls under the Amazon Shared Responsibility model? (Select TWO)
e: Shared Controls apply to both: AWS patches infra, you patch OS. AWS trains their staff, you train yours.

q: An organization has established a new department and hired a large number of employees who will require the same access to some of AWS services. What does AWS provide to help organize them so you do not need to assign permission to each employee individually?
e: Use IAM Groups to manage permissions for collections of users.

q: An application needs to access data in another VPC in the same region. What would enable one VPC to be connected to another VPC?
e: VPC Peering is a direct network connection between two VPCs.

q: What will you include in the business case to attempt to satisfy everyone at the company regarding shifting capital expense to operating expense?
a: Suggest that the company make dedicated hosts or reserved instance purchases
d: Suggest using a different cloud provider
e: Reserved Instances and Dedicated Hosts can often be treated as Capital Expenses (CapEx) for accounting purposes, bridging the gap.

q: Which AWS service can you use to download the AWS PCI report?
e: AWS Artifact is the portal for downloading compliance reports (PCI, SOC, ISO).

q: Which AWS service records the history of configuration changes for your resources to assist with auditing and compliance?
e: AWS Config continuously monitors and records your AWS resource configurations and allows you to automate the evaluation of recorded configurations against desired configurations.

q: In the AWS Shared responsibility Model, which of the following are the responsibility of the customer? (Select TWO)
a: Setting password complexity, Securing VPC (Security Groups)
e: Customer = Security IN the cloud (Data, Ports, Passwords).

q: Which AWS service provides Rate-based rule to mitigate layer 7 DDoS attack?
e: WAF allows you to block IPs that send too many requests (Rate-based rules).

q: Which service can identify the user that made the API call when an Amazon EC2 instance is terminated?
e: CloudTrail logs the identity of API callers.

q: You are tasked with improving the performance of a blog with read-heavy traffic. Which feature of Amazon RDS will help you with it?
e: Read Replicas scale read operations. Multi-AZ is for High Availability (disaster recovery).

q: Which AWS service helps customers to easily collect, process, and analyse video and data streams in real-time?
e: Kinesis is for streaming data (Kinesis Data Streams, Kinesis Video Streams).

q: Which of the following makes it easier for you to manage and filter your resources?
e: Tags act as metadata labels for organization and filtering.

q: A highly scalable application generates record document for each customer which must remain available for immediate download for up to 3 months and then must be deleted. What is the most appropriate storage medium for this user case?
e: S3 is best for files/documents, and Lifecycle Policies handle the deletion automatically.

q: In the AWS Shared responsibility Model, for which of the following does AWS not assume responsibility?
e: AWS is never responsible for your data. That is the customer's responsibility.

q: Which of the following automatically handles the deployment, from capacity provisioning, load balancing and auto-scaling but yet gives you full control over the AWS resources powering your application?
e: Elastic Beanstalk is the 'Platform as a Service' (PaaS) offering that deploys resources you can still see/access.

q: What are the benefits of the AWS Marketplace service? (Select TWO)
a: Quickly launch pre-configured software, Security scans on listed products
e: Marketplace offers speed (pre-made AMIs) and trust (AWS scans products).

q: A company wants to build and replicate its AWS infrastructure in multiple environments. Which AWS service provides the capability for the customer to use templates to describe and then automatically provision the infrastructure resources?
e: CloudFormation uses templates to define infrastructure.

q: A company is migrating to the AWS Cloud and wants to bring their server-bound licenses. Which EC2 pricing model supports this?
e: Dedicated Hosts allow you to control the physical socket/core placement required for BYOL (Bring Your Own License).

q: A company uses EBS volumes to store critical and confidential data hosted on their EC2 instances. A new mandate has been released requiring the company to encrypt data at rest. Which of the following can be used to meet this requirement?
e: KMS manages the encryption keys for EBS volumes.

q: According to the AWS Acceptable Use Policy, which of the following statements is true regarding penetration testing of EC2 instances?
a: Customer can perform penetration testing on their own instances without prior approval for allowed services
d: You must always get prior approval
Only AWS can perform penetration testing
You can only test during business hours
e: AWS now allows pen-testing on common services (EC2, RDS, etc.) without prior approval, provided rules of engagement are followed.

q: Company ABC has been experiencing issues with their Data Centre and has been advised to migrate some of their services to the AWS cloud. They want to use the AWS cloud as an extension to their Data Centre. Which AWS services can they use to establish the network connection? (Select TWO)
a: AWS Direct Connect, AWS Site-to-Site VPN
e: Hybrid connectivity is best achieved via VPN (IPsec) or Direct Connect (Physical).

q: You are writing an application which runs on EC2 instances and stores an object of size 3 GB in an S3 bucket. You want to minimize the time required to upload each item. Which API should you use to minimise upload time?
e: Multipart Upload is recommended for files >100MB and speeds up uploads by parallelizing them.

q: Which of the following AWS security resources are available to any user for free? (Select THREE)
a: AWS Technical Guides, AWS Security Blog, AWS Whitepapers
e: Documentation, blogs, and whitepapers are free public resources.

q: Which of the following AWS services can help you perform security assessment and regulatory compliance auditing? (Select TWO)
e: Config records history for auditing; Inspector scans for vulnerabilities.

q: You suspect that AWS resources are being used for malicious activity (e.g. spam, port scanning). How can you let AWS know?
e: The AWS Abuse Team investigates reports of prohibited use (attacks originating FROM AWS).

q: According to the AWS Shared Responsibility Model, for which of the following is the customer responsible? (Select THREE)
a: Guest OS Patching, Security Groups, Network Access Control Lists
e: Customer manages the Guest OS, Firewall configuration (SG/NACL), and Data.

q: Which AWS service provides hardware security modules (HSMs) to protect your encryption keys?
e: AWS CloudHSM provides hardware-based key storage for regulatory compliance.

q: Which of the following are TRUE about AWS Organizations service? (Select TWO)
a: Unused reserved instances can be shared across the group, Consolidated billing allows you to get volume discounts
d: It is only for large enterprises
e: Organizations allows sharing of RI benefits and combining usage for volume discounts.

q: A company has developed a web application in AWS. What should they do to ensure that the application is highly available?
a: Deploy the application across multiple Availability Zones
d: Deploy the application on a single large instance
e: Multi-AZ deployment is the cornerstone of High Availability in AWS.

q: Which of the following statements is true of AWS regions? (Select TWO)
a: They are composed of Availability Zones, They are physical locations around the world
d: They are logically isolated sections of the cloud
They are always connected via high-speed links
e: Regions are physical locations containing multiple Availability Zones.

q: Amazon GuardDuty is a threat detection service. Which data sources GuardDuty analyse? (Select THREE)
a: AWS CloudTrail logs, DNS logs, VPC Flow Logs
e: GuardDuty's core sources are CloudTrail, VPC Flow Logs, and DNS Logs.

q: What are the main benefits of using the AWS Service Catalog?
a: Enable users to quickly deploy approved IT services
d: Reduce the cost of AWS services
Automate the creation of AWS accounts
Monitor the performance of AWS services
e: Service Catalog restricts users to deploying only pre-approved CloudFormation templates.

q: AWS Organizations enables you to set up consolidated billing across multiple AWS accounts.
e: Consolidated Billing is a primary feature of AWS Organizations.

q: Which of the following are the factors which influence CloudFront cost? (Select THREE)
a: Number of Requests, Data Transfer OUT, Traffic Distribution (Region)
e: You pay for Data Out, Requests, and geographic location of the user.

q: A customer has a high availability application running on an EC2 instance which frequently writes to persistent storage. Which AWS pricing model will provide the LOWEST costs for computing resources?
e: For steady-state applications that cannot be interrupted (persistent storage/HA implies production stability), Reserved Instances provide the best discount. Spot is cheaper but risks interruption.

q: You have added a new employee to the 'Finance' IAM group. Which of the following statements apply to that user?
a: Employee will inherit the permissions of 'Finance' IAM group
d: Employee will need to be assigned permissions manually
Employee will have full admin access
Employee will need to create a new account
e: Permissions are inherited from the Group.

q: Which of the following are TRUE about Amazon S3?
a: The total volume of data and number of objects you can store are unlimited, Files can be from 0 bytes to 5 TB
d: S3 is a block storage service
S3 is a file storage service
S3 has a limit on the number of objects
e: S3 has unlimited total storage. Individual objects max out at 5 TB. It is Object Storage, not Block or File.

q: What are the advantages of using AWS over an on-premises data center? (Select TWO)
a: Go global in minutes, Increase speed and agility
e: Cloud offers Speed/Agility and Global Reach.

q: A company has a VPC with a private and public subnet. They want to enable instances in a private subnet to connect to the internet to be able to install security patches. What is the MOST secure way to enable this?
e: NAT Gateway allows outbound internet access for private subnets while blocking inbound traffic.

q: Which type of IAM policy is attached to a resource, such as an S3 bucket, to control who can access it?
e: Resource-based policies (like Bucket Policies) are attached directly to the resource itself, unlike Identity-based policies which attach to Users/Roles.

q: Which of the following is the most appropriate means for developers to store Docker container images in the AWS Cloud?
e: ECR is the managed registry for Docker images.

q: You have been asked to enable AWS IAM Identity Center (formerly SSO); which service should already be set up on the account?
e: IAM Identity Center (SSO) requires AWS Organizations.

q: A company wants to centrally manage policies across all of their AWS accounts; which AWS service will allow this?
e: Service Control Policies (SCPs) in AWS Organizations allow central policy management.

q: A company has 100Mbps connection and they can use it at 80% capacity to transfer 100TB data from their premise over to AWS S3. What is the MOST cost-effective and FASTER method to achieve this?
e: At 80Mbps, 100TB takes months. Snowball is physically faster (days) and cheaper.

q: What does AWS Cost Explorer provide to help manage your AWS spend?
e: Cost Explorer uses historical data to forecast future spend.

q: You are asked to set up a batch job that runs every Friday night. The job completes in less than 100 minutes and cannot be postponed. Which Amazon EC2 payment model should you use for the best price?
a: Scheduled Reserved Instances (or On-Demand Capacity Reservations)
e: A job that 'cannot be postponed' on a recurring schedule needs capacity assurance. Scheduled RIs (or ODCRs) provide this. Spot is unsafe; standard On-Demand is more expensive.

q: You are using Amazon RDS for MySQL, which of the following features performs automatic failover when the primary database fails to respond?
e: Multi-AZ automatically fails over to the standby instance.

q: Which of the following AWS Services helps customers plan migration projects by gathering information about their on-premises data centers?
e: Application Discovery Service collects server specs and usage data.

q: You are asked to make an image file publicly available on the web. This file will be downloaded by customers using their browser hundreds of thousands of times. Which option will be the most cost-effective?
a: Store the file in Amazon S3 Standard
d: Store the file in Amazon EBS
Store the file in Amazon EFS
Store the file on an EC2 instance
Store the file in Amazon Glacier
e: S3 is designed for high-scale public web delivery. It is cheaper than EC2/EBS for this use case.

q: Which of the following AWS computing services is serverless?
e: Lambda is the definition of Serverless Compute.

q: What support does the Enterprise Concierge Team provide?
a: Help with billing and account inquiries
e: Concierge is the 'white glove' billing/account support for Enterprise plans.

q: Which AWS service makes it easy for you to create and manage cryptographic keys and control their use across a wide range of AWS services and in your applications?
e: KMS is for encryption keys. (Secrets Manager is for passwords/credentials).

q: What are AWS shared controls?
a: Controls which apply to both the infrastructure layer and customer layers
d: Controls that are shared between AWS customers
Controls that are managed by third parties
e: Example: AWS provides awareness training to its employees, and you provide it to yours.

q: With AWS services, you can use as many resources as you need, as well as use them when you need them. Which of the following terms can be applied to this concept? (Select TWO)
e: Elasticity is the scaling; Disposable resources is the mindset enabled by it.

q: Which of the following AWS services should you use to migrate an existing database to AWS?
e: DMS is specifically for database migration.

q: Which of the following are benefits of using the AWS Cloud? (Select TWO)
a: Stop guessing capacity, Increased speed and agility
e: Standard AWS value props: Agility and Elasticity.

q: Which of the following affect Amazon EBS pricing? (Select THREE)
a: Volume size, Region, IOPS (for provisioned types)
e: EBS pricing is based on Size (GB), Region, and Speed (IOPS) for advanced types.

q: Which of the following are a collection of data centers within a specific region?
e: AZs contain one or more data centers.

q: Which of the following AWS services facilitate the implementation of loosely coupled architectures? (Select TWO)
e: SQS buffers messages; ELB distributes traffic. Both reduce dependencies.

q: Which of the following consist of a customer-defined key and an optional value that can make it easier to manage, search for, and filter resources?
e: Tags are Key-Value pairs.

q: What does the AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Calculator provide?
a: Comparison of on-premises vs AWS costs
e: TCO is for 'What if we move to cloud?' analysis.

q: A client wants to use an Elastic Load Balancer which is capable of handling millions of requests per second with ultra-low latency. Which load balancer is most suitable?
e: NLB works at Layer 4 and is built for extreme performance.

q: Which of the following AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)'s best practice adds an extra layer of protection?
a: Enable MFA on the Root User
e: Protecting the Root user with MFA is critical.

q: A company is trying to analyze the costs applied to their AWS account recently. Which of the following lists AWS usage for each service category used by an account and its IAM users?
e: CUR is the most granular data feed available.

q: A company currently uses VM Templates to spin up virtual machines on their on-premise infrastructure. Which of the following can be used to provision another EC2 instance with identical configuration?
e: AMIs act as the template (OS + Software) for EC2.

q: A company has an application that is deployed on servers hosted in their office server room. They are looking to grow their organization's infrastructure by connecting cloud resources to the internal system. What type of deployment model will they be adopting?
e: Connecting On-Prem + Cloud = Hybrid.

q: What are the AWS services or features that can help you maintain fault-tolerant and highly available architecture in AWS? (Select TWO)
e: The dynamic duo of HA/FT: ELB distributes load, Auto Scaling recovers lost instances.

q: A company has developed a media playback application but some of the devices are showing 'format not supported' error. Which of the following AWS services can help them with this issue?
e: MediaConvert is the modern file-based video transcoding service. (Elastic Transcoder is legacy).

q: Which of the following services is an AWS repository management system that allows for storing, versioning, and managing your application code?
e: CodeCommit is AWS's managed Git service.

q: Under the Shared Responsibility Model, which of the following are responsibilities of AWS?
e: AWS = Security OF the Cloud (Concrete, Cables, Hardware).

q: Which service can you use to set alarms to monitor AWS resources?
e: CloudWatch Alarms trigger based on metrics (e.g., CPU > 80%).

q: Which service can you use to route traffic to the endpoint that provides the best application performance for your users worldwide?
e: Global Accelerator optimizes pathing over the AWS backbone to reduce latency/jitter.

q: CloudFront is used to route users to the edge location that provides the lowest amount of time delay in delivering content. Which of the following terms describes this 'time delay'?
e: Latency is the delay.

q: Which tool or service can be used to list the number of Lambda functions in an account?
e: CLI allows listing resources via commands.

q: Which of the following are building blocks of a fault-tolerant system? (Select TWO)
e: SQS (Decoupling) and S3 (Durable storage) help build systems that withstand failure.

q: Which services work together to enable auto-scaling of Amazon EC2 instances?
d: Amazon S3, Amazon EBS, Amazon RDS
AWS IAM, AWS STS, AWS Cognito
AWS CloudFormation, AWS OpsWorks, AWS Systems Manager
e: CloudWatch monitors -> Alarm triggers Auto Scaling -> ELB registers new instance.

q: What does the term 'Economies of scale' mean?
a: AWS continuously lowers costs as it grows
d: AWS increases prices as it grows
AWS prices depend on the user
e: AWS aggregates usage from millions of customers to get better hardware pricing, passing savings to you.

q: Which of the following AWS offering allows customers to find, buy, and immediately start using software solutions in their AWS environment?
e: The Marketplace is the 'App Store' for server software/SaaS.

q: What is the size of the CIDR block you are permitted in an AWS VPC?
e: VPC sizing rules: Max /16 (65k IPs), Min /28 (16 IPs).

q: You have a real-time application that requires sub-millisecond latency. Which of the following services would you use?
e: ElastiCache (Redis/Memcached) provides microsecond/sub-millisecond latency. DynamoDB is single-digit millisecond.

q: AWS Global Accelerator provides cross-region traffic management using the AWS backbone network.
e: Global Accelerator uses the high-speed AWS backbone, bypassing the public internet.

q: A company is hosting an application on an EC2 instance. They want to add a new feature where users can upload their files to the S3 bucket.
a: Create an IAM Role with write permissions and attach it to the EC2 instance
d: Store credentials in the application code
Store credentials in a file on the instance
e: IAM Roles are the secure way to grant EC2 instances permissions.

q: A company has won a big project and has hired new employees, who are split into teams with separate permissions for each team. You have been asked to create IAM users and implement the permissions accordingly. How will you implement this?
a: Create IAM Groups for each team and assign policies to the groups
d: Create a separate IAM user for each employee
Create a single IAM user for all employees
e: Groups are for collections of users (Teams).

q: You are using AWS Organizations and set up consolidated billing. If Reserved Instance sharing is NOT turned on for an account, which is true?
a: Reserved Instance discounts apply only to the account that purchased them
d: Reserved Instance discounts apply to all accounts
Reserved Instance discounts are applied to the master account
Reserved Instance discounts are applied to the newest account
e: If sharing is disabled, the benefit remains local to the purchasing account.

q: You are launching a new application but want to be alerted when your cost or usage amount exceeds a threshold. Which AWS service will enable you to set alarms to meet this requirement?
e: AWS Budgets sends alerts (email/SNS) when you exceed your defined thresholds.

q: What is the key difference between an availability zone and an edge location?
a: Availability Zones run your main infrastructure (EC2/RDS); Edge Locations cache content (CloudFront)
d: Edge Locations are larger than Availability Zones
Availability Zones are located in Edge Locations
Edge Locations are for storage only
Availability Zones are for compute only
e: AZ = Data Centers for Compute/Storage. Edge = Caching points for CDN.

q: What AWS tools can be used to call AWS Services from different programming languages?
e: SDKs (Boto3, AWS SDK for Java, etc.) enable code-based interaction.

q: According to the AWS Customer Service Policy for Penetration testing, which of the following activities are NOT permitted? (Select THREE)
a: DNS zone walking, Simulated DDoS, Protocol flooding
e: You cannot attack the AWS infrastructure itself (DDoS, Protocol Flooding) or try to map it out (DNS Zone Walking).

q: Which AWS framework helps organizations understand how cloud adoption transforms the way they work, and provides structure to identify and address gaps in skills and processes?
e: AWS CAF groups capabilities into six perspectives (Business, People, Governance, Platform, Security, Operations) to help plan migration.

q: The AWS Well-Architected Framework has six pillars. Which pillar focuses on minimizing the environmental impacts of running cloud workloads?
e: The Sustainability pillar focuses on minimizing the environmental impact (energy consumption, carbon footprint) of cloud workloads.

q: Which AWS service analyzes configuration and utilization metrics to make recommendations for rightsizing EC2 instances and other resources to lower costs and improve performance?
e: Compute Optimizer uses machine learning to analyze history and recommend optimal resource configurations (Rightsizing).

q: A company wants to set up a secure, compliant, multi-account environment based on AWS best practices with a pre-configured landing zone. Which service should they use?
e: AWS Control Tower automates the setup of a landing zone (multi-account environment) using best practices and guardrails.

q: Which AWS service allows you to deploy applications at the edge of 5G networks to minimize latency for mobile devices?
e: AWS Wavelength embeds AWS compute and storage inside telecom providers' 5G networks for ultra-low latency mobile apps.

q: What tasks can only be done using root user credentials? (Select TWO)
a: Create a CloudFront key pair, Register as a seller in the Reserved Instance Marketplace
e: Certain account-level tasks are restricted to the root user, including creating CloudFront key pairs (for signed URLs) and registering as a seller in the Reserved Instance Marketplace.

q: Which of the following AWS services supports cross-region data replication? (Select TWO)
a: Amazon Simple Storage Service, Amazon RDS
e: Amazon S3 supports Cross-Region Replication (CRR) for objects, and Amazon RDS supports creating Read Replicas in different regions for disaster recovery and local performance.

q: Which of the following AWS services are free to use? (Select TWO)
e: Elastic Beanstalk and CloudFormation are free orchestration services. You do not pay for the service itself, only for the underlying resources (like EC2 instances and Load Balancers) they create.

q: You have been tasked to create a new IAM user for a new developer who has recently joined your team. Although the user has received all the credentials, she still cannot perform any actions on the Amazon DynamoDB shop table. What can you do to resolve this issue? (Select TWO)
a: Create an identity-based policy, Add the user to the group that has the necessary permissions policy
d: Double-check the credentials you sent to the user
Create a ticket with AWS helpdesk as DynamoDB service has an underlying issue
e: By default, new IAM users have no permissions (implicit deny). To grant access, you must explicitly attach a policy to the user (identity-based) or add them to a group that already has the required policy.

q: Which feature enables you to connect multiple site-to-site VPN connections to a single gateway, allowing your remote sites to communicate with each other?
e: AWS VPN CloudHub operates on a simple hub-and-spoke model that you can use with or without a VPC. It allows multiple sites to communicate via the AWS VPN endpoint.

q: Which of the following affect Amazon EBS pricing? (Select THREE)
a: Snapshots, Volume Type, Fast Snapshot Restore
e: EBS pricing is determined by the volume type (performance), storage capacity, snapshots (storage), and optional features like Fast Snapshot Restore.

q: Which IAM entity can best be used to grant temporary access to your AWS resources? (Select TWO)
e: IAM Roles provide temporary security credentials. While standard Access Keys are long-term, STS generates temporary Access Keys/Session Tokens.

q: According to the AWS Shared Responsibility Model, for which of the following is the customer responsible? (Select THREE)
a: NAT Instance, Security Groups, Network Access Control Lists
e: Customers are responsible for 'Security in the Cloud', which includes configuring firewalls (SG/NACLs) and managing guest OS/software on EC2 instances (like a NAT Instance).

q: Which AWS service uses machine learning to automatically discover, classify, and protect sensitive data (such as PII) stored in Amazon S3?
e: Amazon Macie is a data security service that discovers sensitive data (like credit card numbers) in S3 using ML.

q: Which serverless compute engine for containers allows you to run containers without managing the underlying EC2 instances?
e: AWS Fargate is the serverless compute engine for ECS and EKS that removes the need to provision or manage servers.

q: Which AWS database is a fully managed relational database engine that offers the performance of commercial databases and is compatible with MySQL and PostgreSQL?
e: Amazon Aurora is a high-performance, cloud-native relational database (part of RDS) compatible with MySQL and PostgreSQL.

q: Which service helps you rotate, manage, and retrieve database credentials, API keys, and other secrets throughout their lifecycle?
e: Secrets Manager is specifically designed to centrally manage and automatically rotate secrets (like DB passwords).

q: A company wants to analyze data stored in Amazon S3 using standard SQL queries without provisioning servers. Which service should they use?
e: Amazon Athena is an interactive query service that makes it easy to analyze data in S3 using standard SQL.

q: Which service provides user sign-up, sign-in, and access control for web and mobile applications?
e: Amazon Cognito handles customer identity and access management (CIAM) for your apps (User Pools).

q: Which AWS service allows you to run AWS infrastructure and services on-premises for a truly consistent hybrid experience?
e: AWS Outposts brings native AWS infrastructure (racks/servers) to your on-premises data center.

q: Which AWS tool provides a personalized view of the health of the specific AWS services that are powering your workloads?
e: The Personal Health Dashboard gives you a view of AWS health specific to *your* resources, whereas the Service Health Dashboard is general.

q: A developer wants to analyze and debug a distributed application to understand performance bottlenecks. Which AWS service helps with this?
e: AWS X-Ray provides end-to-end tracing and debugging for distributed applications.

q: Which scalable file storage service supports the Network File System (NFS) protocol and can be mounted concurrently by multiple EC2 instances?
e: Amazon EFS (Elastic File System) provides shared file storage for Linux instances via NFS.

q: Which AWS service allows you to create and publish interactive business intelligence dashboards?
e: Amazon QuickSight is the AWS Business Intelligence (BI) service for visualizing data.

q: Which service enables developers, scientists, and engineers to easily and efficiently run hundreds of thousands of batch computing jobs on AWS?
e: AWS Batch dynamically provisions the optimal quantity and type of compute resources for batch jobs.

q: Which AWS service automates code deployments to any instance, including Amazon EC2 instances and on-premises servers?
e: AWS CodeDeploy automates the actual deployment of code to compute resources.

q: Which AWS service provides a unified user interface so you can view operational data and automate operational tasks across your AWS resources?
e: Systems Manager (SSM) gives you visibility and control of your infrastructure (e.g., Run Command, Patch Manager).

q: A company needs to archive data for 10 years for regulatory compliance at the lowest possible cost. Retrieval time of 12 hours is acceptable. Which S3 storage class is best?
e: S3 Glacier Deep Archive offers the lowest cost storage in the cloud, suitable for long-term retention where retrieval times of 12-48 hours are acceptable.

q: Which feature of the AWS Enterprise Support plan provides a designated technical point of contact who provides advocacy and guidance?
e: The TAM is a primary benefit of the Enterprise Support plan, providing proactive guidance.

q: Which AWS infrastructure deployment places compute, storage, and database services closer to large population centers to deliver single-digit millisecond latency?
e: AWS Local Zones are extensions of an AWS Region that place infrastructure in large cities (population centers) for low-latency requirements.
